nodes.bodyText: you could probably do this in the base class for now
Don't you think CASE statements would be better option here.
Yes, though I'm not planning to extend this anymore I can add a switch case here.
It would be nice if you can add some comments here. Thanks.
I don't see what you mean by that - the logging is sufficient here. Do you mean to add javadoc to the method?
I am wondering why there is no assert here.

There is no assert here because we can not assert on the result - there maybe some errors found during the check and the returned value will be ERROR and not SUCCESS. So if we assert on SUCCESS, then the test could (likely) to be flaky.
We want the test to fail or pass - and we don't expect any exceptions here so if the parameters are not accepted the test will fail, and this is enough check here.
I'll add a javadoc on the top of the method about this.
